content: knit on straight needles then invisibly seamed for a perfect finish short row are used for the shaping and the bobble is optional remember row gauge is the key **i m unable to offer pattern support for my free patterns via ravelry pm or email - please visit the wormhead s hats group 4 if you have a question about this pattern thanks for your understanding ** **yarn** 107-138yd/98-126m/100g chunky weight single or multi-ply yarn **needles & notions** pair 5mm/uk6/us8 straight needles or size needed to obtain gauge stitch markers as necessary tapestry needle approx 3yd/3m waste yarn provisional cast-on 5mm crochet hook provisional cast-on scraps of co-ordinating yarn for pompom **gauge** 16 sts x 20 row to 4in/10cm on 5mm needles over st st 16 sts x 30 row to 4in/10cm on 5mm needles over garter st **sizes** to fit sizes 18 20 22 in/45 75 50 75 56 cm finished size 16 17 75 19 25 in/40 75 45 49 cm **sample details** shown in manos del uruguay clasica 138yd/126m per 100g 100% wool shown in size 22in/56cm on model with 21 75in/55 25cm circumference head **skills required** knit & purl sts short row provisional cast-on kitchener stitch pompoms **accessibility statement** the main pdf for this pattern is colour blind accessible it uses black text on a white background and does not rely on colour 1 https //www woollywormhead com/blog/2007/1/10/sideways-bobble-hat 2 https //www woollywormhead com/knitting-crochet/ 3 https //www woollywormhead com/community-pattern-fund 4 https //www ravelry com/discuss/woolly-wormheads-hats/topics/3891704
